metadata.title: RHSA-2022:1539: xmlrpc-c security update (Important)
metadata.description:
XML-RPC is a remote procedure call (RPC) protocol that uses XML to encode its calls and HTTP as a transport mechanism. The xmlrpc-c packages provide a network protocol to allow a client program to make a simple RPC (remote procedure call) over the Internet. It converts an RPC into an XML document, sends it to a remote server using HTTP, and gets back the response in XML.

Security Fix(es):

* expat: Malformed 2- and 3-byte UTF-8 sequences can lead to arbitrary code execution (CVE-2022-25235)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

bugzilla.text: Malformed 2- and 3-byte UTF-8 sequences can lead to arbitrary code execution

platform: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.1 Update Services for SAP Solutions

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8 is installed
xmlrpc-c is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
xmlrpc-c-client is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
